AddEcdnDomain.document: This API is used to create an acceleration domain name. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
AddEcdnDomain.name: Creates an acceleration domain name

DeleteEcdnDomain.document: This API is used to delete a specified acceleration domain name. The acceleration domain name to be deleted must be in disabled status. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
DeleteEcdnDomain.name: Deletes an acceleration domain name

DescribeDomains.document: This API is used to query the basic information of a CDN domain name, including the project ID, status, business type, creation time, update time, etc. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
DescribeDomains.name: Queries the basic information of a domain name

DescribeDomainsConfig.document: This API is used to query the detailed configuration information of a CDN acceleration domain name. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
DescribeDomainsConfig.name: Queries the detailed configuration of a domain name

DescribeEcdnDomainLogs.document: This API is used to query the access log download link of a domain name.
DescribeEcdnDomainLogs.name: Queries the log download link of a domain name

DescribeEcdnDomainStatistics.document: This API is used to query the statistical metrics of domain name access within a specified time period.
DescribeEcdnDomainStatistics.name: Queries domain name statistical metrics

DescribeEcdnStatistics.document:
This API is used to query ECDN real-time access monitoring data and supports the following metrics:

+ Traffic (in bytes)
+ Bandwidth (in bps)
+ Number of requests
+ Number of 2xx status codes and details of status codes starting with 2
+ Number of 3xx status codes and details of status codes starting with 3
+ Number of 4xx status codes and details of status codes starting with 4
+ Number of 5xx status codes and details of status codes starting with 5
DescribeEcdnStatistics.name: Queries access data

DescribeIpStatus.document:
This API is used to query ECDN node IPs. This API is only available to beta users. Please submit a ticket to use it.

If you need to add the node IPs to your origin allowlist, keep querying the updating the IPs regularly to ensure the success of origin forwarding.
DescribeIpStatus.name: Queries ECDN node IPs

DescribePurgeQuota.document: This API is used to query the usage quota of the purge API. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
DescribePurgeQuota.name: Queries purge usage quota

DescribePurgeTasks.document: This API is used to query the submission record and progress of purge tasks. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
DescribePurgeTasks.name: Queries purge history

PurgePathCache.document: This API is used to purge cache directories in batches. One purge task ID will be returned for each submission. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
PurgePathCache.name: Purges directories

PurgeUrlsCache.document: This API is used to batch purge URLs. One purge task ID will be returned for each submission. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
PurgeUrlsCache.name: Purges URLs

StartEcdnDomain.document: This API is used to enable an acceleration domain name. The domain name to be enabled must be in deactivated status. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
StartEcdnDomain.name: Enables an acceleration domain name

StopEcdnDomain.document: This API is used to disable an acceleration domain name. The domain name to be disabled must be in enabled or deploying status. >? If you have migrated your ECDN service to CDN, you can use the corresponding CDN API.
StopEcdnDomain.name: Disables an acceleration domain name

UpdateDomainConfig.document: This API is used to update the configuration information of an ECDN acceleration domain name. Note: if you need to update complex configuration items, you must pass all the attributes of the entire object. The default value will be used for attributes that are not passed. We recommend calling the querying API to obtain the configuration attributes first. You can then modify and pass the attributes to the API. The certificate and key fields do not need to be passed for HTTPS configuration. >? If your application has been migrated to Tencent Cloud CDN, you can use CDN APIs.
UpdateDomainConfig.name: Updates domain name configuration

TLS version settings. Valid values: `TLSv1`, `TLSV1.1`, `TLSV1.2`, and `TLSv1.3`. Only consecutive versions can be enabled at the same time.

Origin-pull verification status
`off`: Disables origin-pull verification
`oneWay`: Only verify the origin
`twoWay`: Enables two-way origin-pull verification

Configuration information of the origin-pull certificate

Cache.document: Simple edition of cache configuration, which does not support setting a caching rule for scenarios where the `max-age` is not returned from the origin server.

members.document: Caching configuration rule array.
members.name: CacheRules

members.document:
Whether to follow the `Cache-Control: max-age` configuration on the origin server (this feature is only available to users on the allowlist).
on: enable
off: disable
If it is enabled, resources that do not match `CacheRules` will be cached on node according to the `max-age` value returned by the origin server, while resources that match `CacheRules` will be cached on node according to the cache expiration time set in `CacheRules`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FollowOrigin

members.document: Whether to enable full path cache. Valid values: on, off.
members.name: FullUrlCache

members.document: Cache type. Valid values: all (all files), file (extension type), directory (directory), path (full path), index (homepage).
members.name: CacheType

members.document: Cached content list.
members.name: CacheContents

members.document: Cache time in seconds.
members.name: CacheTime

members.document:
Specifies the query metric, which can be:
flux: traffic (in bytes)
bandwidth: bandwidth (in bps)
request: number of requests
2xx: returns the number of 2xx status codes or details of status codes starting with 2
3xx: returns the number of 3xx status codes or details of status codes starting with 3
4xx: returns the number of 4xx status codes or details of status codes starting with 4
5xx: returns the number of 5xx status codes or details of status codes starting with 5
members.name: Metrics

members.document:
Sampling interval in minutes. The available options vary for different query period. See below: 
1 day: `1`, `5`, `15`, `30`, `60`, `120`, `240`, `1440` 
2 to 3 days: `15`, `30`, `60`, `120`, `240`, `1440`
4 to 7 days: `30`, `60`, `120`, `240`, `1440`
8 to 31 days: `60`, `120`, `240`, `1440`
members.name: Interval

members.document:

If no domain name is entered, the specified project will be queried; otherwise, the domain name will prevail

members.document:
Filters by the field name, which includes:
- `origin`: Primary origin server.
- `domain`: Domain name.
- `resourceId`: Domain name ID.
- `status`: Domain name status. Valid values: `online`, `offline`, and `processing`.
- `disable`: Whether the domain name is blocked. Valid values: `normal`, `unlicensed`.
- `projectId`: Project ID.
- `fullUrlCache`: Whether to enable full-path cache, which can be `on` or `off`.
- `https`: Whether to configure HTTPS, which can be `on`, `off` or `processing`.
- `originPullProtocol`: Origin-pull protocol type, which can be `http`, `follow`, or `https`.
- `area`: Acceleration region, which can be `mainland`，`overseas` or `global`.
- `tagKey`: Tag key.
members.name: Name

members.document: Filter field value.
members.name: Value

members.document: Whether to enable fuzzy query, which is supported only for filter fields `origin` and `domain`.
members.name: Fuzzy

members.document: Log start time.
members.name: StartTime

members.document: Log end time.
members.name: EndTime

members.document: Log download path.
members.name: LogPath

members.document: Queries the specified metric. Valid values: Bandwidth, Flux, Request, Delay, status code, LogBandwidth, LogFlux, LogRequest
members.name: Metrics

members.document: Detailed data collection
members.name: DetailData

members.document:
Forced access protocol redirection configuration switch. Valid values: on, off.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
Access protocol type for forced redirection. Valid values: http (forced redirection to HTTP protocol), https (forced redirection to HTTPS protocol).
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RedirectType

members.document:
HTTP status code returned when forced redirection is enabled. Valid values: 301, 302.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RedirectStatusCode

members.document: Whether to enable. Valid values: on, off.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
`MaxAge` value.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: MaxAge

members.document:
Whether to include subdomain names. Valid values: on, off.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: IncludeSubDomains

members.document:
HTTP header setting method. Valid values: add (add header), set (set header), del (delete header).
Request header currently does not support `set`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HeaderMode

members.document:
HTTP header name.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HeaderName

members.document:
HTTP header value, which is optional when it is `del`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HeaderValue

members.document:
Type of effective URL path rule. Valid values: all (all paths), file (file extension), directory (directory), path (absolute path).
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RuleType

members.document:
URL path or file type list
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: RulePaths

members.document:
HTTPS configuration switch. Valid values: on, off. If the domain name with HTTPS configuration enabled is being deployed, this switch will be `off`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
Whether to enable HTTP2. Valid values: on, off.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Http2

members.document:
Whether to enable the OCSP feature. Valid values: on, off.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OcspStapling

members.document:
Whether to enable the client certificate verification feature. Valid values: on, off. The client certificate information must be uploaded if this feature is enabled.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: VerifyClient

members.document:
Server certificate configuration information.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: CertInfo

members.document:
Client certificate configuration information.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ClientCertInfo

members.document:
Whether to enable SPDY. Valid values: on, off.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Spdy

members.document:
HTTPS certificate deployment status. Valid values: closed (disabled), deploying (deploying), deployed (deployment succeeded), failed (deployment failed). This parameter cannot be used as an input parameter.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: SslStatus

members.document:
HSTS configuration
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Hsts

members.document: IP blocklist/allowlist switch. Valid values: on, off.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
IP blocklist/allowlist type. Valid values: whitelist, blacklist.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: FilterType

members.document:
IP blocklist/allowlist list.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Filters

members.document: IP access limit switch. Valid values: on, off.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
Number of requests per second.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Qps

members.document: Node IP
members.name: Ip

members.document: Node region
members.name: District

members.document: Node ISP
members.name: Isp

members.document: Node city
members.name: City

members.document:
Node status
online: the node is online and scheduling normally
offline: the node is offline
members.name: Status

members.document: Node IP creation time
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: Primary origin server list. IP and the domain name of the origin server cannot be entered at the same time. Configure origin server port in the format of ["origin1:port1", "origin2:port2"]. Configure origin-pull weight in the format of ["origin1::weight1", "origin2::weight2"]. Configure both port and weight in the format of ["origin1:port1:weight1", "origin2:port2:weight2"]. Valid range of weight value: 0 - 100.
members.name: Origins

members.document:
Primary origin server type. Valid values: domain (domain name origin server), ip (IP origin server).
This is required when setting `Origins`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: OriginType

members.document:
Host header value during origin-pull.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ServerName

members.document:
Origin-pull protocol type. Valid values: http (forced HTTP origin-pull), follow (protocol follow), https (HTTPS origin-pull).
If this parameter is left empty, HTTP origin-pull will be used by default.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: OriginPullProtocol

members.document: Secondary origin server list.
members.name: BackupOrigins

members.document:
Secondary origin server type, which is the same as `OriginType`.
This is required when setting `BackupOrigins`.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: BackupOriginType

members.document:
HTTPS advanced origin-pull configuration
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: AdvanceHttps

members.document: List of directories to be purged. The protocol header must be included.
members.name: Paths

members.document: Purge type. flush: purges updated resources, delete: purges all resources.
members.name: FlushType

members.document: Purge task ID
members.name: TaskId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Purge task ID.
members.name: TaskId

members.document: Purged URL.
members.name: Url

members.document: Purge task status. fail: failed, done: succeeded, process: purging.
members.name: Status

members.document: Purge type. url: URL purge; path: directory purge.
members.name: PurgeType

members.document: Resource purge method. flush: purges updated resources, delete: purges all resources.
members.name: FlushType

members.document: Purge task submission time
members.name: CreateTime

members.document: List of URLs to be purged. The protocol header must be included.
members.name: Urls

members.document: Purge task ID
members.name: TaskId

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Quota limit for one batch submission request.
members.name: Batch

members.document: Daily submission quota limit.
members.name: Total

members.document: Remaining daily submission quota.
members.name: Available

ResourceData.document: Query object and its access details

members.document:
Resource name, which is categorized as follows based on different query conditions:
Specific domain name: indicates the details of the specific domain name
multiDomains: indicates aggregated details of multiple domain names
Project ID: displays the ID of the specified project to be queried
all: details at the account level
members.name: Resource

members.document: Data details of resource
members.name: EcdnData

members.document: Custom response header switch. Valid values: on, off.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
Custom response header rule array.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: HeaderRules

members.document:
Server certificate ID, which is required if the certificate is a Tencent Cloud-hosted certificate.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: CertId

members.document:
Server certificate name, which is required if the certificate is a Tencent Cloud-hosted certificate.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: CertName

members.document:
Server certificate information, which is required when uploading your own certificate and must contain complete certificate chain information.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Certificate

members.document:
Server key information, which is required when uploading your own certificate.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: PrivateKey

members.document:
Certificate expiration time.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: ExpireTime

members.document:
Certificate issuance time.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: DeployTime

members.document:
Certificate remarks.
Note: this field may return null, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Message

members.document:
Sort by field. Valid values:
createTime: domain name creation time
certExpireTime: certificate expiration time
members.name: Key

members.document: asc/desc. Default value: desc.
members.name: Sequence

members.document: Domain name to be enabled.
members.name: Domain

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document: Domain name to be disabled.
members.name: Domain

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Tag key.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: TagKey

members.document:
Tag value.
Note: this field may return `null`, indicating that no valid value is obtained.
members.name: TagValue

members.document:
Statistical time point in forward rounding mode
Taking the 5-minute granularity as an example, 13:35:00 indicates that the statistical interval is between 13:35:00 and 13:39:59
members.name: Time

members.document: Data value
members.name: Value

members.document: Domain name.
members.name: Domain

members.name: IpFilter

members.name: IpFreqLimit

members.name: ResponseHeader

members.document: Node caching configuration.
members.name: CacheKey

members.document: Caching rule configuration.
members.name: Cache

members.document: HTTPS configuration.
members.name: Https

members.document: Forced access protocol redirection configuration.
members.name: ForceRedirect

members.document: Domain name acceleration region. Valid values: mainland (acceleration in Mainland China), overseas (acceleration outside Mainland China), global (global acceleration).
members.name: Area

members.document: WebSocket configuration.
members.name: WebSocket

members.document: The unique request ID, which is returned for each request. RequestId is required for locating a problem.
members.name: RequestId

members.document:
Whether to enable custom WebSocket timeout setting. When it’s `off`: WebSocket connection is supported, and the default timeout period is 15 seconds. To change the timeout period, please set it to `on`.

* WebSocket is now only available for beta users. To use it, please submit a ticket.
members.name: Switch

members.document:
Sets timeout period in seconds. Maximum value: 65
Note: This field may return `null`, indicating that no valid values can be obtained.
members.name: Timeout
